info.title: Backlinks API
info.description:
### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummary` method gives you general information about link profile: number of external links, referring IP addresses and subnets, number of referring domains and subdomains, domain authority indicator and types of referring links. The data set is similar to the [Overview report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/dashboard/).

<!-- theme: danger -->
> **This method is deprecated*

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 5 API credits are spent per 1 request

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.




Use case:
1. You want to understand what links your competitors have.
2. Use `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummary` to get information about the number of inbound links and referring domains;
3. Determine which sites are linking to your competitors to identify potential link opportunities for your client.

totalIndexed.description: Number of indexed pages on Google

externalDomains.description: Number of domains to which the analyzed site links

outlinksTotal.description: Number of links from the analyzed site

outlinksUnique.description: Number of unique links from the analyzed site

typeAlt.description: Number of links with the filled alt attribute

totalIndexedDynamics.description: Dynamics of indexed pages on Google

externalDomainsDynamics.description: Dynamics of domains to which the analyzed site links

typeAltDynamics.description: Dynamics of links with the filled alt attribute

domainRank.description: Serpstat Domain Rank (SDR) — an indicator of domain authority

left_lines.description: Left credits of lines for your pricing plan

count.description: Number of results in this answer

total.description: Number of results for the request

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummaryV2` method gives you general information about link profile: number of external links, referring IP addresses and subnets, number of referring domains and subdomains, domain authority indicator and types of referring links. 

The data set is similar to the [Overview report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/dashboard/) at Serpstat UI.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 5 API credits are spent per 1 request. 
<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

*The data in this report and all the detailed reports can differ slightly due to the algorithm for quickly calculating summary data.*

Use case: 
1. You want to understand what links your competitors have.
2. Use `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getSummaryV2` to get information about the number of inbound links and referring domains;
3. Determine which sites are linking to your competitors to identify potential link opportunities for your client

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getAnchors` method gives you a list of keywords used as anchors for backlinks of a site you analyze. The data set is similar to the [Anchors](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/anchors/) report. 

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

sort.description:
Sorting by field

* total - the total number of anchors
* refDomains - number of referring domains
* nofollow - anchor attributes
* anchor - the anchor of the incoming link
* lastupdate - date of the first detection

complexFilter.description: Data filtering using complex conditions. The first-level array represents "OR" conditions, and nested arrays represent "AND" conditions.

field.description:
Filter parameter

* **total** - the total number of anchors
* **refDomains** - number of referring domains
* **nofollow** - anchor attributes
* **anchor** - the anchor of the incoming link
* **lastupdate** - link detection date. Value format: `DD.MM.YYYY` (01.01.2001)

compareType.description:
Comparison type

* **gt** - greater than (number value)
* **lt** - less than (number value)
* **gte** - greater than or equal (number value)
* **lte** - less than or equal (number value)
* **eq** - exact match (number or text value)
* **neq** - does not meet the requirement (number or text value)
* **between** - between (two number values, from .. and to ..)
* **contains** - contains (text value)
* **notContains** - does not contain (text value)
* **startsWith** - starts with (text value)
* **endsWith** - ends with (text value)

additional_filters.description:
Additional quick filters

* **no_subdomains** - without links from subdomains of the analyzed domain

refDomains.description: The number of referring domains with this anchor

total.description: The number of backlinks with this anchor

noFollow.description: The number of nofollow backlinks with this anchor

left_lines.description: Left credits of lines for your pricing plan

count.description: Number of results in this answer

total.description: Number of results for the reques

post.description:
`SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getTopAnchors` method returns information about the TOP-10 anchors, the number of backlinks with these anchors, and the number of domains on which the referring pages are located. The data set is similar to the "TOP anchor backlinks by popularity" table from the [Overview report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/dashboard/). 

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per request.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


Use case:
1. With the SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getTopAnchors method, identify the most popular anchors of competitor sites and use the same anchors to promote your site.

data.description: Data object contains info about anchors

domains_count.description: Unique domains with backlinks with this anchor

summary_info.description: Contains an object with data about left credits and additional data

left_lines.description: Left api credits

referring_domains.description: Total qty of reffering domains for requested domain or domain with all subdomains

backlinks.description: Total qty of backlinks for requested domain or domain with all subdomains

unique_anchors.description: Total qty of unique backlinks anchors

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getIntersect` method gives you a list of backlinks from intersecting donors to the analyzed domain. The data set is similar to the [Links intersect report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/intersect/).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getIntersect` method, check what domains are referring to the analyzed domain and its competitors.

* **links_count1** - number of links for domain # 1
* **links_count2** - number of links for domain # 2
* **links_count3** - number of links for domain # 3

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getIntersectSummary` method gives you a list of the number of common domains (donors) that refer to the analyzed domain. The data set is similar to the [Links intersect report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/intersect/).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


Use case:
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getIntersectSummary`, you can compare the link mass of several domains, and find common and unique donors for each site.

intersect.description:
Domains to find common donors with

Example: `["klubok.com", "issaplus.com"]`

left_lines.description: Left credits of lines for your pricing plan

count.description: Number of results in this answer

total.description: Number of results for the request

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getDistributionSDR` method returns an array containing objects with SDR value ranges and the number of domains that are included in these ranges. The data set is similar to the graph SDR distribution in the [Overview report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/dashboard/).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per request.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1. Using this method, SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getDistributionSDR, check which SDR range has the most donor domains of the target site to determine the quality of that site's link profile.

domains.description: Number of domains which range includes

left_lines.description: Left credits of API lines for your pricing plan

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getDistributionTLD` method returns information about the number of domain backlinks that belong to a specific top-level domain zone. The data set is similar to the Referring TLD map in the [Overview report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/dashboard/).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per request.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


Use case: 
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getDistributionTLD` method, determine from what regions users can get to the site based on incoming links.

lang.description: Language in which the `country_name` field value is returned in the response

percentage.description: Percentage of the number of domains from the response object to the total number of domains

order.description:
Sorted order

* **asc** - in the ascending order
* **desc** - in the descending order

biggest_tld_percentage.description: Percentage of domain zone links with the most links to the total number of links

left_lines.description: Left credits of API lines for your pricing plan

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getBacklinksChangesHistory` method returns the history of found and lost backlinks for the analyzed site. The data set is similar to the graphs "Linking page dynamics" and "New and lost backlinks" charts in the [Summary report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/dashboard/).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per request.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getBacklinksChangesHistory` method, use the history of found and lost inbound links to determine changes in the link weight of your site or your competitors' site to further shape your link building strategy.

left_lines.description: Left credits of lines for your pricing plan

count.description: Number of results in this answer

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getLostBacklinks` method gives you a list of lost backlinks of a site you analyze. The data set is similar to the [Lost backlinks report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/lost-links/).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getLostBacklinks` method, check which backlinks your site has lost to further analyze your backlink profile.

sort.description:
Sorting by field

* **url_from** - the referring page
* **anchor** - the anchor of the backlink
* **link_nofollow** - link attributes
* **links_external** - a number of outgoing links from the referring page
* **link_type** - the type of incoming link
* **url_to** - a landing page
* **check** - date of the first detection

complexFilter.description: Data filtering using complex conditions. The first-level array represents "OR" conditions, and nested arrays represent "AND" conditions.

field.description:
Filter parameter

* **url_from** - the referring page
* **anchor** - the anchor of the backlink
* **link_nofollow** - link attributes. Possible values: follow, nofollow, ugc, sponsored
* **links_external** - the number of external links from the referring page
* **link_type** - the type of the backlink. Possible values: text, redirect, iframe, form, canonical, rss, alternate, image
* **url_to** - a landing page
* **check** - link detection date. Value format: `DD.MM.YYYY` (01.01.2001)

compareType.description:
Comparisoin type

* **gt** - greater than (exact number value)
* **lt** - less than (exact number value)
* **gte** - greater than or equal (exact number value)
* **lte** - less than or equal (exact number value)
* **eq** - exact match (number or text value)
* **neq** - does not meet the requirement (number or text value)
* **between** - between (two number values, from .. and to ..)
* **contains** - contains (text value)
* **notContains** - does not contain (text value)
* **startsWith** - starts with (text value)
* **endsWith** - ends with (text value)

additional_filters.description:
Quick filters

* **no_subdomains** - without links from subdomains of the analyzed domain
* **last_week** - data for the last week
* **only_main_page** - only backlinks from main pages

nofollow.description: Link attributes. If several are listed, they're separated by commas. Options: `follow`, `nofollow`, `UGC`, `sponsored`

links_ext.description: Number of  external links from the referring page

last_visited.description: The last date of crawling in format `YYYY-DD-MM HH:MM:SS`

date_del.description: The last date of the link marked as lost by Serpstat bot in format `YYYY-DD-MM HH:MM:SS`

left_lines.description: Left credit of lines for your pricing plan

count.description: Number of results in this answer

대한민국 스트라이크 엘리트 남성 나이키 드라이 핏 ADV 축구 반팔 탑 Nike.com에서 대한민국 스트라이크 엘리트 남성 나이키 드라이 핏 ADV 축구 반팔 탑 찾기. 무료 배송 및 반품. www.nike.com

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getNewBacklinks` method gives you a list of active backlinks of a site you analyze. The data set is similar to the [Backlinks report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/active-links/).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getNewBacklinks` method, check active links leading to a competitor's domain and their domain rank to find out what domains are more preferrable to place links to your site on.

sort.description:
Sorting by field

* **url_from** - the referring page
* **anchor** - the anchor of the backlink
* **link_nofollow** - link attributes
* **links_external** - a number of outgoing links from the referring page
* **link_type** - the type of incoming link
* **url_to** - a landing page
* **check** - link update date (last indexed)
* **add** - date of the first detection (first indexed)
* **domain_rank** - an indicator of domain authority on a scale from 0 to 100

complexFilter.description: Data filtering using complex conditions. The first-level array represents "OR" conditions, and nested arrays represent "AND" conditions.

field.description:
Filter parameter

* **url_from** - the referring page
* **anchor** - the anchor of the backlink
* **link_nofollow** - link attributes. Possible values: follow, nofollow, ugc, sponsored
* **links_external** - the number of external links from the referring page
* **link_type** - the type of the backlink. Possible values: text, redirect, iframe, form, canonical, rss, alternate, image
* **url_to** - a landing page
* **check** - link detection date. Value format: `DD.MM.YYYY` (01.01.2001)
* **add** - date of link discovery, (first indexed). Value format: `DD.MM.YYYY` (01.01.2001)

compareType.description:
Comparisoin type

* **gt** - greater than (exact number value)
* **lt** - less than (exact number value)
* **gte** - greater than or equal (exact number value)
* **lte** - less than or equal (exact number value)
* **eq** - exact match (number or text value)
* **neq** - does not meet the requirement (number or text value)
* **between** - between (two number values, from .. and to ..)
* **contains** - contains (text value)
* **notContains** - does not contain (text value)
* **startsWith** - starts with (text value)
* **endsWith** - ends with (text value)

additional_filters.description:
Quick filters

* **no_subdomains** - without links from subdomains of the analyzed domain
* **last_week** - data for the last week
* **only_main_page** - only backlinks from main pages

nofollow.description: Link attributes. If several are listed, they're separated by commas. Options: `follow`, `nofollow`, `UGC`, `sponsored`

links_ext.description: Number of  external links from the referring page

last_visited.description: The last date of crawling in format `YYYY-DD-MM HH:MM:SS`

left_lines.description: Left credit of lines for your pricing plan

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getOutlinks` method gives you a list of external backlinks of a site you analyze. The data set is similar to the [Backlinks report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/outlinks/). 

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


Use case:
1. with the SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getOutlinks method, check the sites connected to the competitor's domain so you could establish a connection with these sites too to promote your site.

* **links_external** - a number of outgoing links from the referring page
* **link_type** - the type of incoming link
* **url_to** - a landing page
* **check** - date of the first detection

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getLostOutlinks` method gives you a list of lost external links of a site you analyze. The data set is similar to the [Lost external links report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/lost-outlinks/). 

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case: 
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getLostOutlinks` method, check what links your site has lost to find out why they were lost and try to establish these links again.

Sorting by field

* **url_from** - the referring page
* **anchor** - the anchor of the backlink
* **link_nofollow** - link attributes
* **links_external** - a number of outgoing links from the referring page
* **link_type** - the type of incoming link
* **url_to** - a landing page
* **lastupdate** - date of the last check

complexFilter.description: Data filtering using complex conditions. The first-level array represents "OR" conditions, and nested arrays represent "AND" conditions.

Filter parameter

* **url_from** - the referring page
* **anchor** - the anchor of the backlink
* **link_nofollow** - link attributes. Possible values: follow, nofollow, ugc, sponsored
* **links_external** - the number of external links from the referring page
* **link_type** - the type of the backlink. Possible values: text, redirect, iframe, form, canonical, rss, alternate, image
* **url_to** - a landing page
* **check** - link detection date. Value format: `DD.MM.YYYY` (01.01.2001)

compareType.description:
Comparisoin type

* **gt** - greater than (exact number value)
* **lt** - less than (exact number value)
* **gte** - greater than or equal (exact number value)
* **lte** - less than or equal (exact number value)
* **eq** - exact match (number or text value)
* **neq** - does not meet the requirement (number or text value)
* **between** - between (two number values, from .. and to ..)
* **contains** - contains (text value)
* **notContains** - does not contain (text value)
* **startsWith** - starts with (text value)
* **endsWith** - ends with (text value)

nofollow.description: Link attributes. If several are listed, they're separated by commas. Options: `follow`, `nofollow`, `UGC`, `sponsored`

links_ext.description: Number of  external links from the referring page

last_visited.description: The last date of crawling in format `YYYY-DD-MM HH:MM:SS`

date_del.description: The last date of the link marked as lost by Serpstat bot in format `YYYY-DD-MM HH:MM:SS`

left_lines.description: Left credit of lines for your pricing plan

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getOutDomains` method gives you a list of the domains that are linked to the analyzed site. The data set is similar to the [External domains report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/outdomains/?query=phone&se=g_ua&search_type=subdomains).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case: 
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getOutDomains` method, check what domains are linked to a competitor's domain and link your own domain to these domains.

* **domain_rank** - SDR (Serpstat Domain Rank), an indicator of domain authority

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getRefDomains` method gives you a list of referring domains of a site you analyze. The data set is similar to the [Referring domains report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/refdomains/). The data in this report and the Summary report may differ slightly due to the algorithm for quickly calculating summary data.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getRefDomains` method method, check which sites link to your competitors so that you can place links to your site on those same sites.

The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getRedirectedDomains` method returns a list of domains that redirect to or from the specified domain. The method analyzes redirects (301, 302, and others) within the context of the backlink profile. 
<!-- theme: success -->

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getThreats` method returns a list of malicious domains referring to the analyzed domain and information on them. The data set is similar to the [Malicious sites report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/malicious-domains/?search_type=subdomains&type=domains).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getThreats` method, find out what malicious websites are referring to your site and remove these backlinks.

sort.description:
Sorting by field

* **domain_link** - number of links to the domain
* **links_count** - the number of links from the domain
* **platform_type** - the platform for which the site is a threat
* **threat_type** - a type of vulnerability, possible values
* **lastupdate** - link detection date

complexFilter.description: Data filtering using complex conditions. The first-level array represents "OR" conditions, and nested arrays represent "AND" conditions.

field.description:
Filter parameter

* **lastupdate** - date of the first detection
* **domain_link** - number of links to the domain
* **links_count** - the number of links from the domain
* **platform_type** - the platform for which the site is a threat, possible values:
    * 1 - windows
    * 2 - linux
    * 3 - android
    * 4 - OS X
    * 5 - IOS
    * 6 - any OS
    * 7 - all OS
    * 8 - chrome OS

* **threat_type** - a type of vulnerability, possible values:
    * 1 - malware
    * 2 - social engineering
    * 3 - unwanted software
    * 4 - potentially harmful application
* **lastupdate** - link detection date. Value format: `YYYY-MM-DD` (2001-01-01)

* **eq** - exact match (number or text value)
* **neq** - does not meet the requirement (number or text value)
* **between** - between (two number values, from .. and to ..)
* **contains** - contains (text value)
* **notContains** - does not contain (text value)
* **startsWith** - starts with (text value)
* **endsWith** - ends with (text value)

The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getThreatsLinks` method returns a list of links from malicious sites referring to the analyzed domain. The data set is similar to the [Malicious sites report](https://serpstat.com/login/?query=gepur.com&search_type=subdomains&type=links).

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getThreatsLinks` method, find out what malicious pages are referring to your site and remove these backlinks.

post.description:
The `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getTopPages` method gives you a list of leading pages of the analyzed site by the number of backlinks with referring pages, domains and IPs. The data set is similar to the [Top pages report](https://serpstat.com/backlinks/toppages/). 

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: This method charges 1 API credit per result returned. The total credits consumed equals the number of items in the `data` section of the response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

Use case:
1. With the `SerpstatBacklinksProcedure.getTopPages` method, check how many backlinks have different pages of the site to analyze it and optimize future promotion.

id.title: id
id.description: Request / response identifier, prodvided from your side, will be mirrored from request to `id` in response. Example "id":"123"

domainQuery.title: domainQuery
domainQuery.description: The domain name of the analyzed site

searchType.title: searchType
searchType.description:
Search modes for analysis

* **domain** - only domain (`site.com`)
* **domain_with_subdomains** - domain with subdomains (`subdomain.site.com`)

searchTypeUrl.title: searchTypeUrl
searchTypeUrl.description:
Search modes for analysis

* **domain** - only domain (`site.com`)
* **domain_with_subdomains** - domain with subdomains (`subdomain.site.com`)
* **url** - the specific URL (`site.com/path/`)
* **part_url** - URL starts with (`site.com/path/*`)
